required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Differential Diagnosis and Risk Stratification in Patients With Suspected NSTEACS
clinical_study.official_title: Approaches to Differential Diagnosis and Risk Stratification in Patients Hospitalized With Suspected Acute Coronary Syndrome Without Persistent ST-segment Elevation

lead_sponsor.agency: National Research Center for Preventive Medicine

clinical_study.source: National Research Center for Preventive Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate possibilities of rapid differential diagnosis and risk stratification in patients urgently admitted to the CCU with a suspected acute coronary syndrome without persistent ST-segment elevation (NSTEACS).

detailed_description.textblock:
Single centre prospective non-randomised non-comparative study of patients delivered by ambulance and admitted to the CCU with suspected NSTEACS.
Aims of this study are:
1. To characterize the contingent of patients admitted to the CCU with suspected NSTEACS.
2. To evaluate possibilities of fast differential diagnosis and risk stratification in patients admitted to the CCU with suspected NSTEACS using clinical data, ECG, biomarker levels (hsTn, NT-proBNP, hsCPR, cardiac FABP) as well as HEART, ADAPT, EDACS, T-MACS, GRACE, ACTION and TIMI scores.
3. To evaluate the correlation between clinical data, ECG, biomarker levels (hsTn, NT-proBNP, hsCPR, cardiac FABP) as well as HEART, ADAPT, EDACS, T-MACS, GRACE, ACTION and TIMI scores with presence and severity of coronary atherosclerosis in patients admitted to the CCU (intensive care unit) with suspected NSTEACS.

primary_outcome.description: Composite of death, (re) infarction, stroke or re-hospitalization
Final diagnosis - the main reason for urgent hospitalization - according to hospital case history

secondary_outcome.description: Death upon discharge and up to 6 months
(re) infarction upon discharge and up to 6 months
Stroke upon discharge and up to 6 months
Recurrent hospital admissions after discharge form the index hospitalization

other_outcome.description: Revascularisation performed due to sudden clinical deterioration
All adverse events/complications not included in clinical outcomes end points.

clinical_study.condition: Non ST Segment Elevation Acute Coronary Syndrome

arm_group.description: Patients urgently admitted to the CCU with suspected NSTEACS

intervention.intervention_name: Approaches to differential diagnosis and risk stratification
intervention.description: Detailed analysis of clinical course, ECG, biomarkers (hsTn I, CK-MB mass, myoglobin, NT-proBNP, hsCPR, cardiac FABP on admission and after 3 hours; hsTn I, CK-MB mass and myoglobin after 6 hours if needed) as well as HEART, ADAPT, EDACS, T-MACS, GRACE, ACTION and TIMI scores.

study_pop.textblock: Patients delivered by ambulance and admitted to the CCU with suspected diagnosis "acute coronary syndrome (ACS)".

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Delivered by ambulance to the CCU with suspected diagnosis "acute coronary syndrome (ACS)".
2. Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. ACS with persistent ST-segment elevation.
2. Moribund; extremely severe condition on admission with a potentially unfavourable prognosis (cardiogenic shock, coma, cardiac arrest, an urgent need for mechanical ventilation).
3. Overt non-cardiac cause of clinical manifestations at the time of admission (bleeding, pulmonary embolism, aortic dissection, stroke).

overall_official.affiliation: National Medical Research Center for Therapy and Preventive Medicine

clinical_study.keyword: Non ST segment Elevation Acute Coronary Syndrome
